Html:
Hi,

Today I found out this amazing software. I installed everything accoring to the guide.
Installed the software. it found my WSUS server. Generated a certificate. Imported it by MMC on the WSUS server, adjusted the GPO so it would approve other updates from the wsus server.
I created a new update. It pops up in windows updates but I receive the 800B004 error.
Can someone help me?

here is the windows updates log file:

Do I need to publish the self signes certificate to all my clients?

jellekamma wrote:
Do I need to publish the self signes certificate to all my clients?
Yes, that's necessary.

what is the exact location wich this certificate must be in?
Windows update says both of my updates are 14kb in size..

2013-08-23 14:09:44:161 1064 d48 Misc WARNING: Digital Signatures on file C:\windows\SoftwareDistribution\Download\981bd4f51faf15b7f99a622a44b42c0d\fa7d9aa8cdd19213b9ffd616a187d92ff4abe99d are not trusted: Error 0x800b0004
Your client computers doesn't trust the published package.
If you have use the button in WP to generate a self-signed certificate, then this certificate MUST be imported in "Trusted Publisher" and "Trusted Root Authority" in your client computers. you will have to restart these computers after importing the certificate.

• If you are using a selfsign certificate, it should be present in :
    • (Local Computer)\Trusted Publisher.
    • (Local Computer)\Trusted Root Certification Authority.
  • If you are using your own signing-code certificate, it should be present in :
    • (Local Computer)\Trusted Publisher.
    • And the Certificate of the authority who have made this certificate should be in the (Local Computer)\Trusted Roor Certification Authority.

Do I need to publish the self signes certificate to all my clients?
Deploy Certificates by Using Group Policy

Hi,


thanks for the replies

I have generated a new self signed certificate and I installed it on my test machine in the needed locations. Rebooted, but I still receive the error message.
What am I doing wrong>?

I am getting a new error: C0000135

I have generated a new self signed certificate
Doing this, required you to re-sign all locally published updates (right-click on an update and choose re-sign).

Another possibility : http://support.microsoft.com/kb/976982/fr
